meta.title: Complete Data Structures & Algorithms Masterclass - Interview Ready
meta.description: The most comprehensive 6-month DSA program. From basic arrays to advanced graph algorithms. Master problem-solving, competitive programming, and crack FAANG interviews with 500+ problems solved.

program_overview.title: Complete Data Structures & Algorithms Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: From Zero to FAANG Interview Ready in 6 Months
program_overview.description:
This intensive 6-month program transforms beginners into expert problem solvers capable of cracking top tech company interviews. Master every data structure from arrays to advanced graphs, learn algorithmic thinking, dynamic programming, and solve 500+ carefully curated problems.

You'll build strong foundations in complexity analysis, implement data structures from scratch, master recursion and backtracking, conquer dynamic programming, and develop the problem-solving skills needed for competitive programming and technical interviews.

learning_path.phase_1: Foundation (Months 1-2): Arrays, Strings, Linked Lists, Stacks, Queues, Basic Algorithms
learning_path.phase_2: Intermediate (Months 3-4): Trees, Graphs, Heaps, Hashing, Advanced Sorting, Searching
learning_path.phase_3: Advanced (Months 5-6): Dynamic Programming, Advanced Graphs, System Design, Interview Mastery

career_outcomes: Ready for Junior Developer interviews (after 2 months)

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Foundation & Core Data Structures (Months 1-2, Weeks 1-8)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build rock-solid foundations with basic data structures, complexity analysis, and fundamental algorithms.

week_1_2.title: Programming Fundamentals & Complexity Analysis
topics: Setting up coding environment (VS Code, online judges)
Time complexity and Big O notation
Best, average, and worst case analysis
Common complexity classes: O(1), O(log n), O(n), O(n log n), O(n²)
How to approach a problem systematically
problems: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock (Easy)

week_7_8.title: Stacks & Queues
topics: Stack implementation using array and linked list
Stack applications: expression evaluation, parentheses matching
Queue implementation: array-based and linked list

week_11_12.title: Sorting Algorithms Mastery
topics: Insertion sort and when to use
problems: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self (Hard)

week_13_14.title: Hashing & Hash Tables
topics: Collision resolution: chaining vs open addressing
problems: Substring with Concatenation of All Words (Hard)

week_15_16.title: Bit Manipulation & Mathematics
topics: Bitwise operators: AND, OR, XOR, NOT

week_17.title: Phase 1 Assessment
topics: Review of all basic data structures
projects: Implement vector, list, stack, queue, unordered_map from scratch

week_18_19.title: Binary Trees Fundamentals
topics: Diameter, height, and width of tree

week_20_21.title: Binary Search Trees & Balanced Trees
problems: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self (Hard)

week_24_25.title: Tries & Advanced Trees
topics: Word search in matrix using trie
Path compression and union by rank

week_26.title: Phase 2 Assessment
projects: Build online judge with problem bank, test cases, and submission system

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Graphs & Advanced Algorithms (Months 3-4, Weeks 9-17)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Master graph algorithms, advanced problem-solving patterns, and complex algorithmic techniques.

week_27_28.title: Graph Fundamentals & Traversals
topics: Graph representations: adjacency matrix vs list
DFS applications: cycle detection, topological sort
BFS applications: shortest path, level order

week_31_32.title: Minimum Spanning Trees & Network Flow
problems: Min Cost to Connect All Points (Medium)
Number of Operations to Make Network Connected (Medium)

week_33_34.title: Advanced Graph Patterns
problems: Number of Ways to Arrive at Destination (Medium)

week_40_41.title: Advanced DP Patterns
problems: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV (Hard)
Partition to K Equal Sum Subsets (Medium)

week_45_46.title: Advanced Algorithms
problems: Count of Smaller Numbers After Self (Hard)

week_52.title: Phase 3 Final Assessment
projects: Build interactive platform with 50+ algorithm visualizations
Include step-by-step execution and complexity analysis
week_52.assessment: Final Exam - 6 problems in 3 hours (FAANG level)

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Interview Mastery & Career Launch (Months 5-6, Weeks 18-26)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master interview skills, tackle company-specific problems, and launch your tech career.

week_70.title: Final Week & Graduation
week_70.assessment: Final Certification Exam - Comprehensive DSA assessment

phase_4_advanced_production.title: CONTINUOUS LEARNING: Beyond the Course
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Lifetime learning resources and advanced pathways

week_104.title: Career Milestones
week_104.assessment: LIFETIME ACCESS - Continuous support and updates

projects_throughout_course: Phase 1: Data Structure Library, Algorithm Visualizer, Complexity Analyzer
Phase 2: Graph Algorithms Suite, DP Problem Solver, String Processor
Phase 3: LeetCode Clone, Interview Prep Platform, Contest Simulator
Final: Complete DSA Learning Platform with 500+ Problems
skills_mastered: Data Structures: Arrays, Linked Lists, Trees, Graphs, Heaps, Tries, Advanced Trees
Algorithms: Sorting, Searching, Graph Algorithms, DP, Greedy, Backtracking
Techniques: Two Pointers, Sliding Window, Fast-Slow, Divide & Conquer
Analysis: Time/Space Complexity, Amortized Analysis, Proof Techniques
Problem Solving: Pattern Recognition, Edge Cases, Optimization
Interview Skills: Communication, System Design, Behavioral Responses
Competitive Programming: Contest Strategies, Speed Coding, Debugging
Tools: LeetCode, HackerRank, Codeforces, Git, VS Code, Debuggers

prerequisites.motivation: Strong desire to excel in technical interviews

course_guarantees.lifetime_updates: Free access to new problems and content
